==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|studieren}}, from {{der|de|la|studeo|studēre}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ʃtuˈdiːrən/|[-ˈdiːʁən]||[-ˈdiː.ɐn]|[-ˈdiɐ̯n]}} * {{audio|de|De-studieren.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|iːʁən}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|studiert|studierte|studiert}} # {{lb|de|transitive|or|intransitive}} to [[study]] at [[university]] or [[college]] level; to be a [[student]] (of) #: {{ux|de|Sie '''studiert''' Chemie.|She '''studies''' chemistry.}} #: {{ux|de|Seit wann '''studierst''' du?|For how long have you '''been a student'''?}} # {{lb|de|transitive|perhaps slightly|_|dated}} to study [[scientific]]ally; to [[research]]; to perform a study on #: {{ux|de|Er '''studiert''' den Nestbau der Ameisen.|He '''studies''' the nest building of ants.}} # {{lb|de|transitive|slightly|informal}} to look at [[minute]]ly; to study; to [[peruse]]; to [[analyse]] #: {{ux|de|Sie '''studierte''' seinen Brief.|She '''studied''' his letter.}} #: {{ux|de|Er '''studierte''' ihren Gesichtsausdruck.|He '''studied''' her facial expression.}} ====Usage notes==== * Generally not used of private or school learning, nor in the sense of “to review already learnt material”. There are certain exceptions to this, but they are chiefly restricted to idioms or some specific contexts. {{m|de|lernen|Lernen}} is the normal word for this. ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|studier|studiert|h}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|research}} {{l|de|erforschen}}; {{l|de|untersuchen}} {{q|more common}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|dsb|studěrowaś|bor=1}} * {{desc|sh|studirati|bor=1}} * {{desc|sl|študirati|bor=1}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
